website_summaries.verdict: Hikers who are looking for a super-lightweight and great-fitting Teva sandal will find the Holliway worth checking out. Those on a quest for a kind of footgear that provides excellent comfort with beautiful aesthetics to boot may also consider this sandal. That being said, the others complain the build quality of this product. Nevertheless, the Teva Holliway makes for a superbly capable outdoor companion thanks to its magnificent set of top-quality traits.
pros: The Teva men’s Holliway sandal received aces from droves of reviewers for being spectacularly comfortable from top to bottom
A customer even felt like walking on fluffy clouds in this footwear
Its glove-like fit astonished a multitude of verified buyers
Many wearers only had admiration for the Teva Holliway’s extreme lightness
The captivating design of this sandal enamored numerous consumers
This hiking footgear impressed several purchasers with its easy-to-use strap buckle
They said they only needed to make ankle strap adjustments one time with this neat implement
Some users were able to make great use of their Teva Holliway sandals for activities outside hiking
A number of testers found a fantastically supportive arch zone in this gear
cons: A very small number of reviewers criticized the sandal’s straps for being uprooted from the midsole far too soon
It's not durable as expected, some have observed

customer_reviews.title: I love Tevas. I have so many pairs I've lost ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Tevas. I have so many pairs I've lost count. This is the first time I've had a Teva failure. The rear part of the shoe detached from the sole after just a few months. I returned to Teva and they sent me a new pair. Guess what? The same thing happened again. Same point of failure. I'm not harsh on these shoes other than getting them wet regularly. Hey, that's what they are designed for! Some sort of design failure with this shoe. I just ordered another pair of a different design and will return these to Teva. I still love Tevas but not this particular design.
customer_reviews.author: PowerCrazy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Teva sandals for many years, and the quality has always been excellent. I'm an older guy and I just walk around in them. I bought these in July, it is now September and one of the straps has already separated from the sole. I don't even use them every day. The strap isn't torn, it just looks like they didn't put very much glue on them. This is definitely not the Teva quality I was used to. I expected much more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Next level sandals
customer_reviews.text: These are great sandals. The quick release buckle means that you adjust to your foot 1 time, rather than every time you put them on your feet. Once you have the adjusted appropriately you put them on/take them off using the buckle mechanism. It's a small feature that means a lot: 1. quicker to get on & off 2. Less wear and tear on the velcro bits 3. Less wear and tear on the straps It's odd to say, that the little buckle is some next-level stuff on a sandle
customer_reviews.author: B. Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Shaped like Pingpong paddles
customer_reviews.text: In Hawaii I need a sandal with the buckle because we are taking our shoes on and off all the time. I have been very pleased with the Teva Men's Toachi Sandals but my second pair is falling apart and they don't seem to be making them anymore--for no good reason as they were very well reviewed shoes. So I ordered these Holliways because they looked similar and have the buckle. When they arrived, they looked like pingpong paddles on the bottoms of my feet--super wide (almost an inch wider than my foot) and round. I have sent them back. Teva has a habit of ruining good products, let's hope they get something right soon.
customer_reviews.author: Juicebug

customer_reviews.title: Teva sandals losing a step?
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Tevas for decades and they have always lasted a very long time, which is why I would like to give this product a 5-star review. However, two years ago, my Tevas broke after less than a year. I figured it was a fluke, so I ordered them again. It happened again. Same issue: the part near the ankle that is anchored into the sole literally ripped out. That's two pairs in two years, so I'm tempted to give this product a 1-star review. But I still think maybe I'm just unlucky. Teva still seems like a good product, but maybe it's just this one particular model (Holliway) that has poor workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Carlsbaditude

customer_reviews.title: Not Like They Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: In less than one year of intermittent use thees sandals fell apart. The under-heel straps USED to go all the way though and under your foot. Now they are just glued into the sole. These things aren't what they used to be and Tevas should be ashamed of the poor quality they now produce. Way to go #Tevas. Take a world-class product and turn it into cheap garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Olson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart quickly. The straps at the toes came out of the sole after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew stout

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I Owned my previous pair of TEVA sandals for nearly 20years and they were great (far exceeding my expectations). When I purchased these I anticipated these would work well for at least 4-5 years. On my 2nd trip to the boundary waters and less than 2 years old these sandals broke all the straps! They have cheapened them and are now using their past good name to sell an inferior product at a high price.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: I've been wearing Tevas since the 80s and they have ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Tevas since the 80s and they have slowly been going down in quality the side strap pulled out of the base on these. I've been able to fix it but still this is the first time a pair of Tevas is broken on me in the first 4 months usually I'm able to keep them going for three to four years.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Not What They Used to Be - Broke in 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Teva sandals and nothing but Teva sandals for over 30 years. A pair usually lasts me for several years. My last pair lasted 5 years, they were comfortable and made 4 month-long trips throughout Europe, a tour of Egypt and three seasons of sailing throughout Mexico. I bought this pair, the same model with the buckles in June. One of the straps tore out three months later. No trips to Europe or Mexico, never once on a sailboat with them and the strap tore out of the sole. I am more than disappointed with this. Can't recommend them at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Blairbo

customer_reviews.title: Great for Warm Climate Hikes
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for a rain forest hike up the side of a volcano. Kept my feet cool while providing much needed traction. My wife has the all rubber Tevas, which caused blisters on her feet when they got wet. Mine were cloth straps and didn't hurt my feet at all when wet. However, hers dried quickly, while mine took days to dry out. Word of caution if hiking with these, your toes and heels are exposed to twigs, rocks, roots, etc. I did get snagged and almost tripped a few times. It didn't bother me though. These are perfect if you intend to use them for everyday summer shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Life Span
customer_reviews.text: Loved the comfort of these outdoor shoes until the strap embedded into the soul completely tore off after 4 months! I had used them many times for adventures, but really? Either defective or the straps are cheaply made now. Think twice before purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Demian Deas

customer_reviews.title: What the heck were they thinking?
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable for a heavy guy like myself, but the backwards buckle placement has to be one of the dumbest design decisions in history. I find it completely unusable. I almost wonder if it was a joke that actually made it into production. Also, I get a LOT of loose threads on the strap. I won't buy another pair unless I see them being closed out at under forty bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Buscador

customer_reviews.title: Sore Spot
customer_reviews.text: The front strap pinches my foot directly behind my big toe on both feet. The fit is fine, and other than it rubbing a sore spot. I have tried loosening the strap, but so far there has been no relief. I have worn them for a few days now, so I guess they are mine to keep The convenience of the buckle is the reason I got these... trying to stay away from the velcro. But I would gladly trade them for velcro type now
customer_reviews.author: M Pope

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke after two months of wear
customer_reviews.text: Terrible workmanship - the rear strap came loose from the shoe after just over two months of wear, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: User X

customer_reviews.title: I liked them so much I bought 7 pairs! Love the buckle!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let those reviews that show damaged straps deter you. I've been wearing mine for over 2 years, and they're still perfectly fine. These are super comfortable. I used to buy Skechers sandals but they stopped making them with a buckle. The buckle is why I bought these. I don't want to mess with a Velcro strap constantly. I bought 6 more pairs because I like them so much. I tend to hoard things I like a lot. One time I bought a pair of sandals I really liked but when I wanted to buy them again, they were nowhere to be found.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2/24/2020 Broke 7/26/2020 6 months lifespan What happened to Teva? These sandals lasted less than a year! Back in the day I had a pair of Teva last 11 years. I’d highly suggest passing on anything Teva Wow what a joke
customer_reviews.author: WormZ

customer_reviews.title: what has happened to Teva?
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Teva"s for thirty years and they are getting more cheaply made each time I order. this last pair lasted a month and a half before the back heal strap blew out from the sole. Fixed with glue, but now it's five months later and they are falling apart. Sorry Teva, but this is the last pair for me, if the quality matched the price I would continue to be a customer. UPDATE: 9/4/2020 The other heel strap blew out of the sandal today. Not going to glue it. Going into the trash, along with any chance of me overpaying for a pair of TEVA's again. I have had fifteen dollar sandals last longer than these.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McFarland

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these I purchased for my husband. The first pair was in Key West 7 yrs ago and are great. He loved them so much and were looking a little tattered so we found these. They were hardly used and still they were never as comfortable and the strap around the foot has come out! As you can also see in the photo that the front is cracking and that has never happened with any of our other Tevas. I am thinking these are a cheap knock offs as for every pair of Tevas we have ever purchased were the best ever and these are the worst ever!!!! Absolute garbage~
customer_reviews.author: linda jones

customer_reviews.title: ... kayak so I wanted a sandal that would be good around water
customer_reviews.text: I kayak so I wanted a sandal that would be good around water. I ordered a size 10 because my shoe size is 10.5 and the next size up for this sandal is 11. My big toe barely tips the edge so I think itit would have been best if I had ordered size 11. The sole looks and feels great but the front strap isn't all leather and quite thin. I just hope this sandal will hold up under the stress I will be putting it under.
customer_reviews.author: Oldmutt

customer_reviews.title: Ok so this is what feels like to walk on nice fluffy clouds
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this is what feels like to walk on nice fluffy clouds. Amazing shoes wonderful arch! I don't know what is in the material of the sole of these shoes but I hate taking them off they are so darn comfy! My feet are on the road to recovery after a year of almost not being able to walk at all. COODOS to vionic and teva shoes!!! These are the brands of shoes I'll never change.
customer_reviews.author: Malissa

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of sandals
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend to take to a 4-day music festival. It poured one day which lead to massive mud pits and slip-and-slides on every hill. These shoes were AWESOME. They were incredibly comfortable, held traction in severe conditions, and we super easy to clean. I took them outside after our mudfest and power sprayed with the hose. Then tossed them in the wash and let air dry. They look brand new. The snap closure is great for getting in and out of these quickly. My boyfriend usually wears a size 10.5 but these fit better than the 10.5 of another style. Absolutely recommend for anyone looking for a new pair of reliable sandals!
customer_reviews.author: Kourtney Stone

customer_reviews.title: So far so great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear at Walt Disney World, and they worked great! Wore them all 4 days and walked about 10 miles per day. Very comfortable. No blisters or sore spots. No smell. Light yet provide good support. Although a bit awkward to reach at first, I love the clip--allows you to get the Velcro straps adjusted just right and leave them alone. It's also quiet taking them off compared to the tearing sound of Velcro. I can't speak to the durability of these having owned them for just a week, but I hope they last a long time because I'll be wearing them a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Jon F.

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite shoes I've owned in a really long time
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes I've owned in a really long time. They've fit great from the beginning and the clip to unstrap functionality helps keep the velcro from losing its stickiness. I literally wore my first pair (more on that later) to a music festival the first week I had them. I was walking probably 10+ miles a day for 4 days in them and they held up like a champ. Only reason I'm docking a star is because my first pair's strap came unglued under the sole. Bought another pair and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: atomwan

customer_reviews.title: Junk!- front end ripped out of the sole after only 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before a 1 month camping trip out west. 2 weeks into the trip the front of the sandal ripped out of the sole and I couldn't use them anymore. I was disappointed in this poor quality since I had had good luck in the past with TEVA sandals and their durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Junk Sandals fell apart and almost caused me a real bad fall
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are total junk! Fell apart with only a few months of summer use. Almost fell off a trailer had I not had the strength to grab rail to break my fall. I have been buying Tevas for decades, but in the last few years their products have been getting worse! Consider other brands before you buy this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Juan R.

customer_reviews.title: Poor traction
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many pairs of Tevas over the years but they discontinued the model I usually bought. These looked similar but the soles do not do well in wet areas. I have had a number of near falls and one or two actual falls when these gave out on wet surfaces. Not sure what the deal is, but while I love Teva sandals, this model has not worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom  Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Smells like a box of bandaids
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many Tevas, and these are the only ones I'm not happy with. The straps are oddly made, and I struggle with them each time. But worse is the smell. A lot of shoes smell like plastic / adhesive when they are new, but these smell powerfully even after a month, so I can't keep them in my bedroom... they go in the basement. Otherwise, they fit well and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good Travelwear
customer_reviews.text: "I don't wear sandals," but I surprised myself by liking these. They were recommended by my girl, who likes Tevas and recommended that I get some for a vacation on the island of Bali. They are very comfortable and secure once fitted by their velcro adjustments, after which the quick-release clips make them fast on and off. I found them as comfortable to walk in as any good lightweight shoe. Compared to shoes, they have no disadvantages, except for exposure. Thus did I discover sunburned feet, and thus did I receive my only injury of the trip. But that was my clumsiness, not Teva's fault.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Staples

customer_reviews.title: I like the snap lock mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I like the snap lock mechanism. It makes it easier to put on and take off without having to move the Velcro straps and try to adjust the right fit every time you wear the sandals. The inside foot pad is not as comfortable as my other ones, model 4155, which are no longer made. The sole makes a lot of noise at each step. However, it does offer better traction than my older ones. Sadly Teva sandals are made in China. I'm still looking for a well made U.S. made sandal.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Tigra

customer_reviews.title: Change of opinions/Very disappointed in these
customer_reviews.text: Update: My son posted his broken sandal on Twitter and Teva contacted him to advise how he can return. My faith is restored so I bought a new pair and if they replace, he will have a spare pair. Very disappointed in these! Bought on 14JUN and back strap pulled out of base on 10AUG. My son wears these fishing on a boat and shore and they did not stand up to normal wear for a sport sandal. Not the Teva quality I remember.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Nabholz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Workmanship, the quality you'd expect from Teva
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fell apart (both shoes at the same time) within six weeks. For some reason Amazon refunded me only $31 of the $40 I spent. So I'm still down nine bucks and having to go shop for shoes again for my son. Not amused.
customer_reviews.author: Daydreamer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy! Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This Review Has Been Revised Below Original Review I ordered according to the sizing recommendations, but I wish I had only went down 1/2 size rather than a full size. Two toes come right to the edge. (***SEE BELOW***) ***Update May 14th - Now that I am actually wearing these daily, I have adjusted the straps to where these fit well. My toes come just to the edge only when my foot is being pushed forward now. The sizing is good once you get the straps right, and going a 1/2 size up might actually be too much once the straps are arranged properly. I'm very happy with the quality and fit now. Especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got these hoping to replace my Toachi 2's. The upper of these sandals is almost identical. The bottom however seems like a serious downgrade. The footbed isn't nearly as comfortable or contoured, the traction isn't nearly as good. Send like they went a lot cheaper and for she reason they're wider overall for no apparent reason but it makes them look clunky.
customer_reviews.author: Mars Allred

customer_reviews.title: Broken Strap
customer_reviews.text: Despite only infrequent wear, a strap broke in less than a year. I am not sure if these are Teva first quality shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: straps easily detach from the sole.
customer_reviews.text: after less than a year the straps, which dont go all the way through from side to side are flimsily glued through a slit and about an inch and half under the top of the sole. they easily tear out. also water seems to "dissolve" whatever cheap adhesive they used. im now searching for a more rugged brand than teva. i had my original pair for over 10 years (blue nylon). the old straps used to go through the entire sole as a loop.
customer_reviews.author: LCH

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated with quality
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and comfortable. Durability is its downfall. This is my second pair that has come apart where the strap is glued to the sole of the shoe. This pair lasted less than a year but considering I only wear them 3-4 months out of the year equals a flawed product. I see too that others have made the same comment. They lowered the price significantly this year but I still think I will try another line of footwear. Teva I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Faunce

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Sandals - Now Discontinued :(
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer discontinued these earlier this year :(. Sad decision! Once I knew they were discontinued, and I found them on Amazon, I ordered two sizes and two colors so I could try them on at home. Once I had my size, kept the two of that size, and I ordered two more so that I have enough to last me until I die (maybe). I love the clip on - I do not like Velcro on shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: ripped my husband's feet apart
customer_reviews.text: spaces between the straps rubbed my husband's feet raw and they became very painful to wear. They cheapened these so the material doesn't go all the way across
customer_reviews.author: Cindyh

customer_reviews.title: IDEAL! - Love the clip, cushion and arch support!!
customer_reviews.text: LOOVE these! The arch support is perfect and really rare. The cushion is perfect. They're water proof. The clip means you don't have to keep adjusting or guessing what size everything should be. Took a while to figure out the right setting of all 3 velcros - turned out it was tighter in the back pushing my foot forward. These are perfect, I got them for my tour of Europe and I get them again when/if they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fogel

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman who ordered a size 8 (I wear a 10 in women's) and they fit great. I love having the buckle to wear these so the Velcro does not wear out. My last pair I had lasted at least 10 years, or at least I made them last 10 years. These are exactly as described by the seller. They have great arch support and cushion, which make them very comfortable, even for long periods of time of wear for long distances.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy one size smaller.
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes but you need to buy one size smaller than your normal shoe size. I knew that so I'm good.
customer_reviews.author: Big Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to comments on sizes. I wear a Sz 9 shoe but the Teva Sz 8 fits me best.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the Teva sandal but this is the second pair that rubs the top of my left foot where the ligament/bone (?) goes to my big toe. I am using a moleskin patch and/or a "Toe-Kini" foot protector which help. Maybe my skin will toughen-up because these are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: KC8RXQ

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for every day urban wear.
customer_reviews.text: These tevas are heavier than the "hurricanes", with a thicker sole. I do like the snap closing of the top strap. It is becoming easier to use as the straps wear in and assume the proper shape for my foot. The straps have a leather like feel on top, so I don't think the strap tops will develop that fuzzy teva look. These are the sandals I use to go to the gym, for ease of removal and putting back on. I am glad it bought them.
customer_reviews.author: brwydave

customer_reviews.title: These sandals are junk.
customer_reviews.text: Pure junk. I have had these sandals for two months. As seen in the photo, they broke while I was simply walking, and now they are useless. By all means, buy them if you only want them for a month or two, or if you have money you intend to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Loupee

customer_reviews.title: Straps broke loose from sole.
customer_reviews.text: These did not last. The straps popped loose from the soles. I returned the shoes to Teva with the appropriate paperwork, but they have no record of it. They have become an irresponsible company.
customer_reviews.author: lil bubba

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: We've never owned a pair of TEVA sandals that have tore apart like this. We bought them in June and have had them repaired three times, only for the straps to pull out of the shoe bed again. This is truly unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Green eyed lady

customer_reviews.title: Quick-clip is great, Quality is not
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves these. He especially loves the quick-clip for slipping on and off easily. Ordered his normal size and fits perfectly. Straps are thin and flat so they don't' look bulky. 12/2018 update After wearing these for 2 summers and 2 winter beach vacations, the front strap broke while we were on vacation. He did really like them but I expected better from Teva so we didn’t immediately order another on.
customer_reviews.author: Essie

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Returned because I found the footbed uncomfortable. I think I have sensitive feet but the little ridges right under the ball of the foot was uncomfortable. Also the Velcro adjustments could be a little longer. They really barely fit across the top.
customer_reviews.author: Bud B

customer_reviews.title: As advertised so far
customer_reviews.text: They're comfortable, light, well made and fit well. The buckles make them easy to put on and take off, along with no worrying about Velcro wearing out. I like the arch support, which I haven't had in previous sandals (from different manufacturers). Occasionally some pads covering plastic clips roll over, but it's no big deal to straighten them out. I've only had them for a few weeks, so it's hard to say how they'll wear. I'm pleased so far and would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lusk

customer_reviews.title: No longer a choice
customer_reviews.text: Teva, at one time, offered great quality. Now, Teva offers nothing that one cannot get at the cheap discount shoe stores. Shoes that may (if you are lucky) make it through one season.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: A TEVA Sandal Sensation
customer_reviews.text: After several years of wear and tear on my old Teva's, these are my new replacement footwear for the summer journey's. They fit superbly and are obviously well designed and constructed. A little lighter in weight than my previous similar pair. Looking forward to many miles in my Teva's.
customer_reviews.author: Oldlakers

customer_reviews.title: My husband is obsessed with these sandals
customer_reviews.text: My husband has never worn sandals. He's not used to seeing his toes peeking out of sandals. We recently visited a very hot climate for vacation. I suggested my husband get these so his feet wouldn't sweat. He ended up loving them. Now, he wants to wear them everywhere. I love that he can get them wet with the hose to rinse the sand out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren on the Elk River

customer_reviews.title: Attractive enough, not durable
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave the shoes a rating of 4. I liked them, but recently switched to a 1. After less than a year, the sandal came apart. I am not doing any hardcore hiking, just walking around the kitchen. So know there are potential quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: tdubsound

customer_reviews.title: Love the clips, not the smell.
customer_reviews.text: I wish more manufactures would make sandals with clips; adjust once and then easy in, easy out. My only complaint is that if my feet get wet, these things somehow make my typically non-smelly feet smell nasty.
customer_reviews.author: skjos

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled! Great at first but didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Really didn’t hold up very long, a disappointment for Teva! Next time I will spring for Chacos because these should last longer than 2 1/2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Glamazon momma

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe - but bump up a 1/2 size
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a hammer toe/corn and has been uncomfortable walking, even with a 'sleeve' from Podiatrist. I finally talked him into Teva Sandals and he wears them everywhere - including biking, walking and even on the elliptical. Even though he has always worn size 11, we went to 11.5 after this pair, as his toes overhang a little.
customer_reviews.author: JMfromNC

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these sandals! They fit great. They are very well made (as expected by Teva). I love the quick release attachments over the angle. I don't ever use the Velcro anymore for this reason. Once the strap has been adjusted to fit my foot, I'm done with it. To take these sandals off, I just click the quick release.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I love the snap on buckle on the side
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Teva's that were about 10 years old and they finally had to be replaced. I love the snap on buckle on the side. You set the straps up once for your size foot and what feels good and you're done. I liked these so much I bought a second pair, different color. Great arch support. When the weather is nice I wear these all day.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Butryn

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and the clips are handy.
customer_reviews.text: Love these sandals! This is my second pair, I loved the old ones so much that I’ve worn them ragged. Actually I wore them in my finishing room and speckled them with poly u.
customer_reviews.author: James W

customer_reviews.title: Where's the quality?
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last pair of Teva sandals July '19, having been very pleased that the pair before lasted 5yrs. Unfortunately this last pair has just broken - the strap came un-anchored from the base, and I can't fix it. Disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: onas1

customer_reviews.title: These are shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are shoes. I ordered the correct size so they fit. I like the plastic quick release buckles. My wife hates it when I wear these in public with socks.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Doza II

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, was not sure if they would be wide enough. Usually I get blisters on my small toe, but not with this sandal. Very comfortable, replacing a similar pair buy Teva I've had for about 8 years. Great brand, consistent fit.
customer_reviews.author: kembchris

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandal
customer_reviews.text: I like this style because of the ease of taking on and off without having to undo any straps. Comfortable and durable, I've been using them for years.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: The sandal were comfortable while they lasted, however the front strap came unglued and separated from the foot bed rendering the sandals unwearable. The treads and straps still look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Not the Teva I knew and loved.
customer_reviews.text: I have this style 4 times over. Just started wearing these new sandals a week ago and the rubberized fabric faux leather waterproof whatever is shedding its top layer leaving the fabric bare. What a shame to destroy a product name after 20 years of excellent performance I’ve experienced over 4 pairs of the SAME style. Shameful really
customer_reviews.author: harpo

customer_reviews.title: Needs Design Changes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on August 29th 2017. They didn’t last a year. The toe strap pulled out. I though Teva was good quality, but not anymore. I have Skechers sandals that are 4 years old and cost far less that I will go back to. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick N.

customer_reviews.title: Love these sandals
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 15 year old pair of Teva 'Walking Sandals' from LL Bean. It took a while but I wore those down to the nub. These are basically the same sandals, but with considerably more cushion and the quick-release buckle. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be!
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing a size 13 Teva sandal for 20 years. The 13 Holliday was way too small and I sent them back and got a size 14 and it is nearly too small. Materials are a bit flimsy from what I am used to from Teva. I will probably consider another brand when I buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: torture device
customer_reviews.text: Who is the moron who designed a gap over the large toe, so it scrapes off the skin when you wear it? Front strap needs redesign
customer_reviews.author: Helmuth E. Freericks

customer_reviews.title: price increase and fell apart fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought these one year ago for $51 and now $85? I've had most of the heel strap tear out to the sole within 6 weeks of wearing them. BAD
customer_reviews.author: RLHT

customer_reviews.title: I like this pair better than a more expensive pair I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of TEVA. I like this pair better than a more expensive pair I had gotten previously. The straps on this one does not overlap and hang out the sides of the sandal like the other pair I had. Wish they came in half sizes. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have warn this sandal all through Europe and used it in Yosemite as well. The sandal is comfortable to wear for long durations. It's easy to take on/off with the buckle feature. It's runs slightly on the larger side but better than being too small. Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Calabrese

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke
customer_reviews.text: Nice sandals, but unfortunately one of the straps pulled out of the base with less than a year of normal use. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Enterprise I.

customer_reviews.title: Strap Broke in under 3 months
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were very nice. The durability was very disappointing. Within 3 months of purchasing these the side strap came out from the base of the shoe and now they are unusable. I contacted the seller and they were unwilling to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Roomy & not too ugly!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 13 yr old son for our trip to AZ. He climbed Cathedral Rock in them with ease! Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: LittleJulie

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Decent sandals but not very comfortable. The strap that goes over the ankle was uncomfortable and the sandal seemed to be about half a size too small. I returned these and instead bought the Teva Hudson which fit and feel awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Not Your Avg. AMZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The strap came unattached from the soul of the shoe. I have not wore them much because I live in the Northeast Don’t get them wet are they will fall apart
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Second pair of Teva's - my go to trekking sandal
customer_reviews.text: I wore my first pair until they broke - use them for travel, hiking open trail, riding bicycles - wherever I need a solid open shoe. One of my favorites
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Young

customer_reviews.title: Straps pull out of sole
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these for my son who wears them one season. After one season the first pair had a back strap that pulled out of the sole. I ordered him a second pair thinking it was maybe unlucky. NOW his second pair had the front strap pull right out from the sole! FRUSTRATING. Tevas are too expensive not to last multiple seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same product, lasted 1/4 as long.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these sandals nearly all the time. Tevas have been lasting me about 9 months to a year. This pair only lasted 3 months. They stretched more than several pair of previous Teva Toachi's. I purchased this sandal because it was the one of the few available with the buckle quick-release at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Fogel

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 pair, both broke same place.
customer_reviews.text: Got them for my son and he loves them. Problem is both pairs broke in the same place. Only wore them a couple months before they broke. Love the comfort but expensive for something that doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Christiane Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Needs better buckle placement
customer_reviews.text: Fit and comfort are good. Reason for deduction is due to buckle being placed to outside of sandle thereby making it difficult to fasten.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holliway you like it
customer_reviews.text: This is the 9th pair of Teva's I have owned in the last 15 years. The holliway is very comfortable and seems to be as sturdy as the previous teva line . One quick note buy on sale dont buy the ones that are inexpencive at list price. Get a good deal on a higher priced sandal ,the comfort is so much better and worth the little bit more .
customer_reviews.author: JohnD

customer_reviews.title: TEVA SANDALS Best sandals ever
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are well made. I have been wearingvTevas since myvearlyvyears as a raft guide in the 80's
customer_reviews.author: Louis Szuch

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe - but it doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: I love this Teva shoe. However, this is the second pair that I’ve owned, and both have failed in the same way: the straps pull out of the rubbery bottom. I’m going to order another pair because I like them so much but I’m very disappointed that they only last about a year before they fail.
customer_reviews.author: Tim N.

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and the addition of the snap buckle makes it heaven. I don't have to listen to the velcro tear as I take them off. That makes for a better daily wear also.
customer_reviews.author: trark2

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Durable!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this pair of shoes as a gift to replace a similar “older model” of Tevas for my husband. Turns out that he likes these even better than the first ones (which lasted several years!). He is looking forward to many more years to come with these!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn G

customer_reviews.title: I only buy Teva brand sandals.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few models of Teva sandals that come with a quick release buckle. It may not seem like much, but the buckle makes it much easier to get in and out of the sandal. Plus you only need to adjust the fit once and then forget about it. This is a great sandal for any sort of outdoor activity. Especially boating, hanging out at the beach, or just trudging through mud puddles.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Oosterhout

customer_reviews.title: The quick release rocks
customer_reviews.text: I live in a country where you take your shoes off before entering any house or Wat. The velcro straps are a pain in the behind The quick release on the ankle straps work great and are the main reason I bought the Holiways
customer_reviews.author: usa-thai

customer_reviews.title: The Holliway style is my new favorite, with a flat inner sole that is easier ...
customer_reviews.text: The Holliway style is my new favorite, with a flat inner sole that is easier to keep clean than thewhich has too many nooks that collect sweat and dirt.
customer_reviews.author: dj-1984

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the comfort from this shoe. Wish they came in 1/2 sizes though. He bought the 11 which is what he wears. The toes are right at the end but the 12 would be too big. He’s keeping them because they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Shadley

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a 6 Day Grand Canyon Whitewater Rafting trip. Day 2 while out on a short hike, one of the back straps pulled out of the sandal. A knife and some zip ties fixed the problem to continue on. Next day while swimming, front strap on same shoe pulled out. More zip ties and a knife fixed the problem. Day 5, while hiking, rear strap on other sandal pulled out. More zip ties to fix the problem. TEVA is suppose to be an “adventure” company, so hopefully I just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: I did my research on it and it looks like its well made
customer_reviews.text: I"m assuming my husband loves it because he sent me a msg to say thank you which he probably wouldn't normally bother and would wait until he saw me in person. I did my research on it and it looks like its well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without my Teva’s
customer_reviews.text: Previous pair lasted 6 years with many miles finally strap came loose from sole of shoe. I ordered replacement pair within 2 minutes of breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Filipowsky

customer_reviews.title: Teva Quality is Decreasing
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these 6 years ago and they held up great for 4 years until I lost one. Second pair I bought lasted less than 6 months of actual use before the strap broke away from the sole. I fear Teva's quality is decreasing. I have been a long time Teva fan, but I am starting to look for other sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Best sandal
customer_reviews.text: Best sandal for my feet. My pinky toes are somewhat painful and this particular sandal allows my toes to be unencumbered.
customer_reviews.author: noel m jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals. Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: The short time I have had these I have loved them and wore them often. However while wearing them and working on a few misc things around the house, one of the straps attached to the footbed came off with the looks of ripped stitching. The other side did the exact same thing within an hour of the first one. If possible I would like an exchange for another pair or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Rodvik

customer_reviews.title: I really love the inside opening option though
customer_reviews.text: I was a Toachi lover and I cannot find them anymore but this looked similar so I tried it. Much wider and the arch is not in the same place. Sending back. I really love the inside opening option though.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Fogelman

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this sandal
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this sandal. Fit well and I loved the buckles. Sadly they just don't hold up. After just over a year (5 months of actual use) one of the straps pulled off from the sole. I'm not sure I will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun B.

product_meta.title: Teva Mens Holliway-M Holliway-m
product_meta.description: Sporty sandal featuring three adjustable hook-and-loop straps and quick-release buckle at ankle Pull-on loop at counter Shock-absorbing ShocPad technology Spider Rubber outsole for traction and durability Faux Leather Rubber sole Shipping Note: Shipping to Alaska, Hawaii, P.O. Boxes, and APO addresses is not available for this item
feature_bullets: Sporty sandal featuring three adjustable hook-and-loop straps and quick-release buckle at ankle
Spider Rubber outsole for traction and durability
